Package dbtools

Class DBOperations

  • java.lang.Object
    • dbtools.DBOperations
  • public class DBOperations
extends java.lang.Object
    Class DBOperations offers basic methods for interacting with the MySQL data base. Operations of select, update a table, and use a data base are implemented.

    • Method Detail

      • selectMySQLTableFlightForUpdate

        public static boolean selectMySQLTableFlightForUpdate​(java.sql.Connection db_conn,
                                                      FlightReservation fr)
        A check is happened with two select operations in Flights table. To cross the information that the two flights have number of seats equal or greater than user passengers.
        Parameters:
        db_conn - Data base connection
        fr - FlightReservation object to get information
        Returns:
        True if the two flights preserves indeed seats equal or greater than passengers. Otherwise false.

      • selectMySQLTableFlightForSeach

        public static java.util.List<Flight> selectMySQLTableFlightForSeach​(java.sql.Connection db_conn,
                                                                    java.lang.String from,
                                                                    java.lang.String to,
                                                                    java.util.Date flight_date,
                                                                    int passengers)
        Search the two flights from user criteria applying two select into table.
        Parameters:
        db_conn - DataBase Connection
        from - departure airport
        to - arrival airport
        flight_date - flight date
        passengers - number of seats user wants
        Returns:
        Return List of Flight objects filled with real Flight objects in case that Flights can be found according to user criteria. Otherwise return an empty List of Flight objects.

      • useMySQLDataBase

        public static void useMySQLDataBase​(java.sql.Connection db_conn)
        Use flight_sys MySQL Database.
        Parameters:
        db_conn - Database Connection

      • updateMySQLTableFlight

        public static boolean updateMySQLTableFlight​(java.sql.Connection db_conn,
                                             FlightReservation fr)
        To complete a flight reservate request, two update actions must occured. Column seats of these two flights decreased by passenger number.
        Parameters:
        db_conn - Database connection
        fr - FlightReservation
        Returns:
        True if the two update actions can be completed. False otherwise.
